content: In the following questions, I will provide you with a graph (given as an array of nodes and an array of edges), a starting point, and a target point. Please return the shortest path from the starting point to the target point in the following format: 1->2->3->4... Please note that your answer should only include the result in this format and should not contain any other words.(Notice that for the same graph, if the endpoint is changed to the previous point, the new shortest path should be the original shortest path minus the last point.)

The shortest path from node 4 to node 6 in the provided graph is:

1->2->4->6 The path is three nodes long.

Note that the path you provide is in reverse order compared to the order you mentioned in the question. It is because the endpoints of the path should be the previous node. Therefore, if you change the endpoint to the previous point, the new shortest path should be the original shortest path minus the last point.

So, if you change the endpoint from 6 to 4, the new shortest path will be:

1->2->4->6-4=2 The new shortest path is two nodes long.

The shortest path from node 4 to node 4 in the provided graph is:

1->2->4 The path is three nodes long.

Note that the path you provide is in reverse order compared to the order you mentioned in the question. It is because the endpoints of the path should be the previous node. Therefore, if you change the endpoint to the previous point, the new shortest path should be the original shortest path minus the last point.

Therefore, changing the endpoint from 4 to 4 results in no change to the shortest path, as it is already the shortest possible route.
